page.title: 03INTRODUCTION - Law and order
page.content: The centre 6 squares of the survey area form a Home Beat, known as Mill Ward and St.James East Ward, policed by the Bushey Police Station. Bushey is in the Barnet Division of the Metropolitan Police Force. The police contrast central London where "travelling" crime is predominant with Bushey where 50% of the population live in their own homes and "residential" crime is a problem. The most common offences commited in the area include burglary (140 reports in 1984), criminal damage and vehical crimes. 50% of the Beat constable's arrests in 1984 involved teenagers in crime but drug offences, drunkeness and solvent abuse are rare. There are no significant racial minorities in the area but the large and growing Jewish community is occasionally the target for vandals.
